strings.Value: {mf|Baron|Baroness|King|Queen} {name}, rightful ruler of these lands."
"None of your business."
[Attack] "I didn't come here to talk. Die, scum!"
"Why do keep upsetting the locals?"
[In a loud voice] "I was just passing through when I saw you and I thought to myself: 'why, I should come pay my respects!'"
"How can I persuade you to allow the villagers to live in peace, and depart these lands for good?"
[Attack] "You shouldn't have said that. Make peace with your gods!"
"Leave, and never come back. I won't repeat myself."
"Wait. Are you talking about Kimo – the elven craftsman who's in love?"
[Pass the bottle to the satyr] "Here's your medicine."
"What are you talking about?"
"I must go."
"Alright, alright. Sorry about that."
[In an even louder voice] "Huh?! You were saying?!"
"Whoops, sorry. I didn't mean to."
[Screaming] "What?! Why are you whispering?! Speak up, please!"

{n}The foul, nauseating stench of morning-after breath permeates the glade. Fey of all sizes and shapes litter the ground, sleeping on the grass side by side, some of them scarcely clothed. A drowsy satyr squints in pain and shifts his heavy gaze to you.{/n}
"Curses… Who is it? Who's there?"
{n}The satyr winces.{/n} "Quiet, quiet, you hornless devil… What you want here?"
"Ha! I swear I could tell that just by looking at your puffed up chest… What you want?"
"Some of them forget their place… We won't stand by while some pointy-eared oaf frolics with our girls!"
"Ha! A midget {mf|baron|baroness|king|queen} of a midget country… What you want?"
"Ha! With a muzzle like that? You could at least file the tusks down first… What you want?"

{n}The satyr stares at you with an expression of pure agony on his face.{/n} "Ga-a-ah, what the hell. I couldn't care less about your damn villagers… My head's splitting in two. Just bring me a drink. The poison is the cure, you know? You bring me a drink, and I'll take the gang home. It's not like I'm ever going to change her mind, that scatterbrain..."
{n}The satyr hisses, covering his eyes with his hand:{/n} "In the name of all that's good and fair, lower your voice…"
{n}The poor creature gives a weak moan.{/n} "By the gods, why are you yelling so loud…"
{n}Baring his teeth in a grin, the satyr reluctantly rises.{/n} "Rise and shine, you drunkards! We're going home!"
{n}The satyr huffs a dull laugh.{/n} "You're just full of yourself, aren't you?"
"Oh, you know him? How sweet. You can tell him he'll not be getting anywhere with her. That sorry sack of stones doesn't need anyone except her tree…"
"Get lost, go talk to that elf of yours! See if I care!"
"Huh, not bad… It's no fun playing tricks on those dim-witted farmers anyway. Farewell, then. I'm not going to miss your face."
"You again…"
{n}The satyr waves at you dismissively.{/n} "I'm not bowing to you. You've no power over me…"
{n}The satyr sighs in relief, massaging his temples.{/n}
{n}The tormented satyr grabs his head in desperation, as his face turns into a grimace of pain and fear.{/n} "Alright! I get it! We're leaving! Get up, you bastards! We're going home!"
